channel.title: April Pack - Ambient Rimshots!
channel.description: Auxy just made a rlly cool pack called “Ambient Rinshots.” It is really chill and dreamy, check it out? Any thoughts on it..?

item.title: April Pack - Ambient Rimshots!
item.dc:creator: Db909
item.description:
I disagree with calling it a toy, only because the audio engine is so rockin and easy to make sound great I don’t think that’s a small achievement, but I hear ya. At this point, this audio engine is the only thing going for this app. I’m not even sure the ease of use of the interface can really be praised to the degree it was as recent updates have made things a little confusing and now you hear all the time about folks finding “workarounds”. I sincerely believe a keyboard/pads/playing surface and live recording would inject a massive dose of fun into this thing and garner a lot of goodwill and subscriptions even from folks who may still be on the fence. Perhaps not many have asked for that besides me. I see it as a thing people may not know they want but if they were to have it they would be very happy

Plus, word on the street is that other app which shall not be named may be adding live recording. Which they were staunchly not concerned with for a while. So take that for whatever it’s worth. I dunno

Read full topic

item.title: April Pack - Ambient Rimshots!
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
And this brings up another reason why I don’t feel Auxy to be the answer it used to be for me anymore. Things that are important to the users are not important to the developers in some circumstances. There’s plenty of documented requests that have been repeatedly dodged, ignored and were forgotten in favor of other things. I understand the limitations of a two-person team, but if what people are requesting isn’t important you’re no longer developing an application for them but you’re developing an application for yourself. And that’s where it becomes a toy rather than a tool. And that’s from personal experience as well.

Read full topic

item.description:
Well yeah why not. I’d assume quantization to the current grid settings would be a no brainer

item.title: April Pack - Ambient Rimshots!
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Doubtful. There’s plenty more users that asked for alternate time signatures for over 3 years now, and that is still viewed as something that is not a priority in any sense. Three requests for drum delay isn’t going to be that much more of a priority.

Read full topic

item.title: April Pack - Ambient Rimshots!

item.description:
Oh. Well then maybe they’d consider it! How exciting

item.title: April Pack - Ambient Rimshots!
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Because there’s so much offered by other things at this point that I now have access too. Seeing how Auxy cheeses its sounds by looping samples instead of generating them. How frustrating it is to work with sounds you don’t understand. The currently abysmal free user experience especially disheartens me.

More so, I refuse to allow myself to be limited to Auxy, because Auxy is limiting me and my happiness. Trying to write music that will not be recognized. Sticking to an app only because I have history to it. It’s a legacy system.

akabillposters:

it’s much more capable than the word ‘toy’ would imply.

It is, and it can do even more, but from the way I see it, it insists on limiting itself arbitrarily.

Read full topic

item.title: April Pack - Ambient Rimshots!
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
DJ_La_Rocca:

Please make a post on the “post your great Auxy features here” thread. It would be awesome

…and quite possibly the third time I’d made that request on that thread.

Read full topic

item.title: April Pack - Ambient Rimshots!
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
TheRealJFalc:

I’ve been struggling to see Auxy as anything other than a toy

Despite being one of its most vocal critics, I think it’s much more than a toy.
I manage to squeeze some very ‘un-toy-like’ stuff out of it, to the point that even Lenberg isn’t sure if there’s any Auxy in my tracks.

It’s a p.i.t.a. having to use pitch automation to create melodies with imported tonal samples (and I’m not sure how long my patience will last for this method), but still, while it may not be a fully pro unit, even I’d concede it’s much more capable than the word ‘toy’ would imply.

…imo.

Read full topic

TheRealJFalc:

I’ve been struggling to see Auxy as anything other than a toy at this point.

item.title: April Pack - Ambient Rimshots!
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
DHO:

so assuming they aren’t synthesized recording that many orchestral instruments can get expensive.

I would pretty much guarantee the strings pack wasn’t based on fresh, custom recordings.
More likely they’re based on royalty-free samples - which is fine and makes much better sense from a cost perspective.

Read full topic

item.title: April Pack - Ambient Rimshots!
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
akabillposters:

“can manage without it” is likely to turn into “I’ll choose an app that doesn’t require me to ‘manage without’ basic features.

That’s already the case for me, honestly. I’ve been struggling to see Auxy as anything other than a toy at this point. And that saddens me. A walled-off toy that tries to appeal to new users but has systems for only advanced users.

Read full topic

item.title: April Pack - Ambient Rimshots!

item.description:
Agreed. Plus, although it’s not much the pack is actually pretty nice.
